item.title: Biological Database
item.description: GBIF provides very large datasets of biological beings. I downloaded a dataset and implemented some infrastructure to present it in the browser. The dataset had 7 million entries. I grouped them into 757 entries. I developed a Restful API to provide the data through HTTP protocol and a ReactApp that may consume it. Currently, everything is deployed in Heroku. The Link to the site is here. Deployment is under free account so loading is a bit slow.

item.title: Triangulation
item.description: Delaunay triangulation is a special triangulation, where the circumcircle of any triangle in the triangulation does not contain any vertex in its interior. L’idée was proposed in 1934 by Boris Delaunay in his paper Sur la Sphère Vide [1]. The triangulation’s emptiness property maximizes the smallest interior angle of the triangles in the triangulation and has important applications to several areas, including mesh generation. A robust C-language implementation of mesh generation and refinement that applies Delaunay triangulation is Triangle, made by Jonathan Richard Shewchuk in 1996: Engineering a 2D Quality Mesh Generator and Delaunay Triangulator [2].
